Patapsco Valley is easily the largest park (save the narrow Rock Creek National Park) in the densely populated section of the country between
As such, it is quite popular with day-trippers and campers alike seeking to escape the suburban sprawl for a while, and to explore its natural and historic sights.
The park is located just west of the
Beltway, and the principal road in the area is US-40, the Baltimore National Pike, which cuts right through the park. The main visitor center is located at 8020 Baltimore National Pike,

value: content=A 300 foot suspension walkway over the Patapsco River.

content=The world's longest multiple-arched stone railroad bridge. Of course, it's not too hard to set a record when you set your sights on such a narrow category, but the bridge is in any rate quite pretty, and worth a visit.
content=A giant tire playground, which would bore only the most Nintendo DS addicted kid.

Call +1 888 432-2267 for reservations, which are often necessary in nice weather, given the lack of camping opportunities in this densely populated section of the state.
Tent and Cabin camping are possible in designated campsites; the former costs $10/night and the latter $20. Separate from these campsites are sites for RV camping, with full hookups for $25.
